com.inherentgames

Class BBBubble

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.threed.jpct.Object3D
      • com.inherentgames.BBWordObject
        • com.inherentgames.BBBubble
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class BBBubble
extends BBWordObject
    Author:
    Tyler BBBubble is a class that extends BBWordObject. Every bubble shot during gameplay is a new BBBubble, and is added to the graphics engine and physics engine.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • BBBubble

        public BBBubble(com.threed.jpct.SimpleVector translation,
        BBWordObject.Gender article,
        long timeInMillis)
        The Constructor for BBBubble. Takes in a translation vector, an enum Gender, and a time created. The constructor will add the appropriate color to the bubble, depending con what the Gender given to it. Base JPCT-AE handling is done in the constructor, but physics is added during declaration.
        Parameters:
        translation - - a JPCT-AE SimpleVector that gives it a starting point (if bubble not shot from (0,0,0)
        article - - BBWordObject enum Gender can have either a feminine or masculine state
        timeInMillis - - the time of creation, in milliseconds

    • Method Detail

      • setHeldObjectId

        public void setHeldObjectId(int id)
        Called when a bubble captures an object in the room. It will set its variable heldObjectId to the world id of the object captured, as received by the JPCT-AE function Object3D.getID()
        Parameters:
        id - - an int passed in of the captured object's world id

      • getHeldObjectId

        public int getHeldObjectId()
        Called when needing the world object id of the captured object. It is used for rotating the object and updating its location relative to the bubble.
        Returns:
        heldObjectId - the world object id of the held object (if any)

      • setLocalBodyIndex

        public void setLocalBodyIndex(int index)
        Used for the 'bubbles' ArrayList in BBRoom to keep track of all bubble id's, since it is not native to JPCT-AE's 'World' class. Stored in local variable 'localBodyIndex'
        Parameters:
        index - - the int index of this bubble in the BBRoom.bubbles ArrayList

      • getLocalBodyIndex

        public int getLocalBodyIndex()
        Gets the localBodyIndex of this bubble in the BBRoom.bubbles ArrayList
        Returns:
        localBodyIndex - an int representing the location of this bubble in BBRoom.bubbles

      • getBodyIndex

        public int getBodyIndex()
        Gets the index of the bubble's jBullet object RigidBody to find the object in the physics engine.
        Returns:
        bodyIndex - an int that refers to the bubble's RigidBody id in the physics engine

      • setBodyIndex

        public void setBodyIndex(int index)
        Sets the index of the bubble's jBullet object RigidBody to find the object in the physics engine.
        Parameters:
        index - - an int that refers to the bubble's RigidBody id in the physics engine
